.class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit SocketImpl extends Java.Lang.Object implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable, class Java.Net.ISocketOptions, class System.IDisposable
type SocketImpl = class inherit Object interface ISocketOptions interface IJavaObject interface IDisposable interface IJavaPeerable

Docs.summary: The abstract class SocketImpl is a common superclass of all classes that actually implement sockets.

remarks.para: The abstract class SocketImpl is a common superclass of all classes that actually implement sockets. It is used to create both client and server sockets.
A "plain" socket implements these methods exactly as described, without attempting to go through a firewall or proxy.
Added in 1.0.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride Sub SetOption (optID As Integer, value As Object)
public: abstract void SetOption(int optID, Java::Lang::Object ^ value);
public abstract void SetOption (int optID, Java.Lang.Object? value);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetOption(int32 optID, class Java.Lang.Object value) cil managed
abstract member SetOption : int * Java.Lang.Object -> unit

Docs.param: identifies the option
the parameter of the socket option
Docs.summary: Enable/disable the option specified by optID.

remarks.para: Enable/disable the option specified by optID. If the option is to be enabled, and it takes an option-specific "value", this is passed in value. The actual type of value is option-specific, and it is an error to pass something that isn't of the expected type:
If the requested option is binary, it can be set using this method by a java.lang.Boolean:
remarks.code: s.setOption(TCP_NODELAY, Boolean.TRUE); // OK - enables TCP_NODELAY, a binary option
remarks.para: Any option can be disabled using this method with a Boolean.FALSE:

For an option that has a notion of on and off, and requires a non-boolean parameter, setting its value to anything other than Boolean.FALSE implicitly enables it.
Throws SocketException if the option is unrecognized, the socket is closed, or some low-level error occurred
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Protected Overridable Sub SetPerformancePreferences (connectionTime As Integer, latency As Integer, bandwidth As Integer)
protected: virtual void SetPerformancePreferences(int connectionTime, int latency, int bandwidth);
protected virtual void SetPerformancePreferences (int connectionTime, int latency, int bandwidth);
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetPerformancePreferences(int32 connectionTime, int32 latency, int32 bandwidth) cil managed
abstract member SetPerformancePreferences : int * int * int -> unit override this.SetPerformancePreferences : int * int * int -> unit

Docs.param: An int expressing the relative importance of a short connection time
An int expressing the relative importance of low latency
An int expressing the relative importance of high bandwidth
Docs.summary: Sets performance preferences for this socket.

remarks.para: Sets performance preferences for this socket.

Sockets use the TCP/IP protocol by default. Some implementations may offer alternative protocols which have different performance characteristics than TCP/IP. This method allows the application to express its own preferences as to how these tradeoffs should be made when the implementation chooses from the available protocols.

Performance preferences are described by three integers whose values indicate the relative importance of short connection time, low latency, and high bandwidth. The absolute values of the integers are irrelevant; in order to choose a protocol the values are simply compared, with larger values indicating stronger preferences. Negative values represent a lower priority than positive values. If the application prefers short connection time over both low latency and high bandwidth, for example, then it could invoke this method with the values (1, 0, 0). If the application prefers high bandwidth above low latency, and low latency above short connection time, then it could invoke this method with the values (0, 1, 2).
By default, this method does nothing, unless it is overridden in a sub-class.
Added in 1.5.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Protected Overridable Sub ShutdownInput ()
protected: virtual void ShutdownInput();
protected virtual void ShutdownInput ();
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void ShutdownInput() cil managed
abstract member ShutdownInput : unit -> unit override this.ShutdownInput : unit -> unit

Docs.summary: Places the input stream for this socket at "end of stream".

remarks.para:
Places the input stream for this socket at "end of stream". Any data sent to this socket is acknowledged and then silently discarded.
If you read from a socket input stream after invoking this method on the socket, the stream's available method will return 0, and its read methods will return -1 (end of stream).
Added in 1.3.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: always because this method should be overridden.

MemberSignature.Value: Protected Overridable Sub ShutdownOutput ()
protected: virtual void ShutdownOutput();
protected virtual void ShutdownOutput ();
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void ShutdownOutput() cil managed
abstract member ShutdownOutput : unit -> unit override this.ShutdownOutput : unit -> unit

Docs.summary: Disables the output stream for this socket.

remarks.para: Disables the output stream for this socket. For a TCP socket, any previously written data will be sent followed by TCP's normal connection termination sequence.
If you write to a socket output stream after invoking shutdownOutput() on the socket, the stream will throw an IOException.
Added in 1.3.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: always because this method should be overridden.
